paragraphs.text: By hiring Bret Stephens, the Times is making a mockery of its new ad campaign on the importance of truth — and it is impugning the reporting of its own professional journalists.
paragraphs.name: 4b22

dc8f66aca151.title: A columnist is not a reporter.

paragraphs.name: 49f8
paragraphs.text: A columnist is not a reporter. A columnist does not influence how the news is reported. A columnist spouts opinions. Do people really not know this?

paragraphs.name: 710e
paragraphs.text: Did the Times hire Stephens to comment on climate change? It is far from rare that a person can be bat-shit nuts on one topic and rather trenchant and insightful with respect to some other topics. Take “campus rape”, for example. This is a genuine problem, an indubitable reality. It is not, however, an exceptionally severe problem compared to what…

paragraphs.name: 1e36
paragraphs.text: Here I was ready to condemn the Times again, turns out they may be getting back to real news. They just hired a man who understands what modern climate scientists can’t seem to grasp, that climate change is a natural and constant process, not caused by man.

a99654c1106a.title: Actually, it depends on Stephens’ specific role.

paragraphs.name: 91d0
paragraphs.text: Actually, it depends on Stephens’ specific role. If he’s part of the editorial board, the board debates the topics, reaches a consensus, and assigns writers to write the editorial. He may serve a purpose to force all the editors to hear the most extreme objections and respond in the editorial.

paragraphs.name: 64bc
paragraphs.text: Click bait pure & simple.

paragraphs.name: f960
paragraphs.text: I generally tend to believe the science … and the number leave no doubt- teh globe is warming up.. and there is a climate change. But after a whole lot of reserach I am coming to think that behind all of this “denier” “accepter” (or whatever the expression is… there is a much deeper issue…. and that is teh one no one is dealing with… I am talking…
Shame on the Times. No “opposing opinion” is needed on the issue of human-caused climate change because the “opposing opinion” is purposeful dishonesty.

e014859d6054.title: I suggest that fairness demands that we withhold our criticisms until we see what Mr.

paragraphs.text: I suggest that fairness demands that we withhold our criticisms until we see what Mr. Stephens actually does at the New York Times. It might well be that his functions there do not have anything to do with climate change. For all we know, he could be an excellent reporter on, say, financial shenanigans. Let’s condemn the crime when we have one — a sort of intellectual habeus corpus.

paragraphs.text: In a fawning press release, the Times calls Stephens “a beautiful writer” who brings to the paper, “profound intellectual depth, honesty and bravery.”

paragraphs.text: I would just like to point out the guy is also a bad writer. Just look at the myriad stylistic and grammatical errors in the quote about hysteria that Joe Romm supplied.
